trustfund:
TF024852-SOCIAL SECTORS UNIT IN LA PAZ,TF024849-HUMAN RESOURCES UNIT IN LA PAZ,TF031471-BOLIVIA - HEALTH,TF025268-PHRD-SECOND INTEGRATED HEALTH
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project is
            rated as satisfactory: the project achieved most of its
            objectives and generally provided a model for improving
            primary health care delivery in urban and peri-urban areas.
            Some of the key lessons learned are: 1) It is vital to
            involve all players who participate in developing the sector
            in project preparation and supervision; and to decentralize
            decisionmaking and financial resource allocation. 2) Project
            objectives and design should be clear to all those involved
            in project execution; and implementation procedures must be
            sufficiently flexible to adapt to rapid changes in
            government policies and structure. (The flexibility of
            project design and credit agreements allowed quick,
            extensive changes to be made, which drastically improved
            project performance). 3) Creating an organizational culture
            based on participation, open dialogue, team work, client
            orientation, and the use of total quality management
            techniques leads to increased productivity. 4) Strong
            commitment among high government levels has to exist in
            order for there to be enforceable sub-contracts between
            government agencies. 5) If the administrative and financial
            department has weaknesses, it is useful to enlist an
            internal auditor with experience in Bank procurement
            procedures. 6) It is crucial to ensure that the terms of
            reference are well-written, that only qualified consultants
            are hired, that construction guides and procedural manuals
            are developed and applied.
